docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly disapproved yesterday the Union of South Africa's proposal to annex South-West Africa. The Assembly requested South Africa to submit a United Nations.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 14--The Argentine-Chilean commercial treaty signed in Buenos Aires this week interlocks the economy of the two southernmost South American countries and has widespread implications for this whole continent.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18--The International Monetary Fund, established under the Bretton Woods agreement, will begin operations on March 1, with the par values of the participating countries thus far recorded all valued at the existing rates of exchange.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18--The International Monetary Fund, established under the Bretton Woods agreement, will begin operations on March 1, with the par values of the participating countries thus far recorded all valued at the existing rates of exchange.
docs.abstract: Dir Gutt announces beginning of operations March 1; 30 members accept stabilized exch rates, 7 request more time, 2 ask exceptions; IMF aims, activities and working formula revd; table of par values of member countries currencies

headline.main: WORLD-FUND START IS SET FOR MARCH 1; Existing Exchange Rates Are Basic in the Formula, With Changes Expected Later ACCEPTED BY 30 NATIONS 7 Others Ask for More Time on Agreeing to Stabilize and 2 Request Exceptions Parities of Britain and France Working of the Formula World Fund to Start Operating March 1 On Formula of Existing Exchange Rates
